intro: Rinorea anguifera, commonly known as the thread-leaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, pale green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Rinorea anguifera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
